title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Plan International Canada
Interview Descriptions: First call by phone to screen the profile matching with the requirements and to provide more information on the position and salary scale. It was also about to share information on the recruitment process.
Interview Questions: Q : What are you Spanish and French language level? Q : are you planning to take any vacation in the next 6 months? Q : what is your availability? Q : what is your salary expectations?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Plan International Canada
Interview Descriptions: Technical questions with specific questions related to resul based management . 2 interviews, the first for screening , and the second the assess if the person has all requirement such as experience , diploma nd certificates. Also questions about soft skills.

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Plan International Canada in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was 4 stages. 1st round was with the HR, and the remaining was with the Director, Sr. manager, and BA. It was mixed between behavior questions and situational questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with Plan.?

title: Communication Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Plan International Canada
Interview Descriptions:
It was a 4- step long process - 3 interviews and 1 assignment. Clearly, they did not hire me, but no one at the organization had the courtesy even to let me know their decision. Each one of the just disappeared. What a waste of time!!

Learn to be kinder - Maybe you need a 'Plan for Change' as an employer

title: Donor Relations Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Plan International Canada in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions:
There were 3 interviewers. Each of them asked questions. The program Director was very supportive. 
The interview lasted for over 45 minutes.  Didnt receive a favorable reply though. All the very best for all those who are trying
Interview Questions: What is your understanding on the child protection policy

title: Senior Financial Analyst, FP&A Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Plan International Canada (Toronto, ON) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: The whole process took 1 month from applying to getting the interview. First interview was set with the HR (virtual). Couple of days later had another virtual interview with the Hiring Manager and Director. They wanted examples from my current job.
Interview Questions: Could you please tell me about yourself?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Plan International Canada (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was over the phone with an HR rep. When I was notified of the interview (Friday) I was told it would be taking place on Monday (a little hard to accommodate when you have a job... but I made it work because I was interested). I had what I thought to be a great discussion with a seemingly genuine representative. Questions were standard and it lasted about 45 minutes. I asked when I would hear back and she assured me, regardless if my candidacy is pursued or not, I would know by that Friday. I did not hear from her for 6 weeks despite me following up 3-4 times. Her response was the generic 'we are no longer considering your candidacy, best of luck!'. In my opinion this is extremely unprofessional and shows disrespect for applicants and lack of transparency in the hiring process.

title: Donor Care Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Plan International Canada (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: Employer conducted more than 10 interviews on the same day. They were behind schedule and did not seem that professional or organized. The trainer was very demanding and not welcoming. The recruiter was very nice and professional.
Interview Questions: Pretend you have your own talk show, what celebrity would you invite and why

title: Donor Care Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Plan International Canada (Toronto, ON) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was one day. It began in a group setting for a multiple hire cohort where we learned more about the role and the organization. Following was a one-on-one interview with a team lead and the "second stage" was a one-on-one interview with a representative from people and culture.
Interview Questions: Based on your past experience, why do you think you are a good fit for the role?

title: Donor Care Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Plan International Canada
Interview Descriptions: My experience: Checked into front desk, got guest pass, waiting, mins later interviewer came and took me to a meeting room and left. Then after 5 mins 2 interviewers came. They were super friendly. Offered water/coffee. And the interview begun, straightforward questions.  Just make sure you emphasize on communication skills and customer service. Was not too bad. Later after 1 day I received a call back and an email. Overall, one of my best interviews.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with challenging customers?

title: Programs Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Plan International Canada in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Application > Phone Interview (Briefly went through resume) > Video or in Person (more detailed about how experience relates to role, etc). The interview process was typical, brief and nothing too hard. Just make sure you are relating your experience and skills to the role and team.
Interview Questions: What was a difficult situation you were in and how did you handle it?

title: Jr. Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Plan International Canada (Toronto, ON) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Interview process was pretty normal. Started with a 15min phone call asking the generic questions, tell me about previous experience, why would you be a good fit, etc. 

If that phone call was successful, you were invited to first round interviews, which in my case were with the Senior designer (the only designer at the time) and a manager of the design team. This in-person interview was about 1h long and had a portfolio review, where I had to show my work and talk about my design choices, etc. 

After the first round interview, if you were successful, you are apparently supposed to have a second round of interviews with higher up staff, including director or VP level. This did not happen in my case, as a week later I got the call and a job offer.
Interview Questions: How you do define your design and working style?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Plan International Canada (Ottawa, ON) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Clear steps but long process. skills evaluation was simple. Language evaluation. rigorous adoption process. For them, was most important my experience rather that my diplomas. I have to do tests
Interview Questions: What are your strengths? ... Why did you leave your last job? ...

title: Senior Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Plan International Canada in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with the HR team and then the Director and VP of the department. The HR interview was over the phone, followed by the group interview in-person. Great team and amazing group of people.
Interview Questions: General experience, challenges and problem solving, experience directly related to the role.

title: Donor Support Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Plan International Canada (Toronto, ON) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied through indeed and contacted over the phone to come in for a in person interview. Met with 5 people, 3 sat in on my initial interview (hiring manager, trainer and HR rep) than met another HR rep and another manager.
Interview Questions: Why do you wanna work for Plan International?

title: Retail Fundraiser Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Plan International Canada (Toronto, ON) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Brought in with another interviewee, had a quick ice-breaker, answered a few questions and role played. Had to describe why I think the work that Plan International does is important and why I think I am a good candidate for the job.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here? Why do you think this type of work is important?

title: Fundraiser Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Plan International Canada in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very simple over the phone. Then called in for a group interview. Got a response the same day. Nothing too crazy to prepare for, very easy and on the spot questions. Overall it was very good.
Interview Questions: What are you future plans in life?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Plan International Canada (Toronto, ON) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: quick decision. good questions. courteous and professional. panel interview with 4 people. somewhat of an intimidating environment, very swanky offices. dont let that deter you. if you prepare and are qualified, you'll be considered.
Interview Questions: standard. why do you want this job etc. nothing really out of the blue. prepare to speak eloquently and professionally. Style over substance.
